## Agenda

- Overview (~15mins)

- Validate final ranking (~45mins)

- How to provide feedback to submitters? (~5mins)

- Open discussion (~15mins)

- Outlook (~10mins) 


# Overview (~15mins)

---

## This meeting

- Baseline rating: aggregated standardized scores

- This meeting: raise issues and validate a proposal for final ranking

---

## Final inclusion criteria

- No fictional characters

- Implementability (how ready is the stimulus?)

- Diversity 

  - avoid redundancy: when complementary elements, try to merge (offer authorship to all teams); when essentially the same, pick only the best rated/most promising one
  
- Unrelatedness to outcome variable

- Qualitative reviewer comments

--- 

## Solution for similar interventions

- when complementary, try to merge (offer authorship to all teams) 

- when essentially the same, pick the best rated/most promising one


# Validate final ranking (~45mins)

---

```{r}
# extract stimulus text
stimulus_text <- reviews_wide |> 
  filter(code_name == "miserly mackerel") |> 
  pull(stimulus)

name_rank <- reviews_wide |> 
  filter(code_name == "miserly mackerel") |> 
  mutate(label = paste0(code_name, " (rank ", ranking_std, ")")) |> 
  pull(label)
```

::: columns

::: {.column width="70%"}

#### ``r name_rank ``

<pre style="font-size: 0.42em; line-height: 1.2; white-space: pre-wrap;">
`r stimulus_text`
</pre>

:::

::: {.column width="30%" .fragment .smaller}

### Reason for exlusion

No fictional characters

### Comments

<div style="font-size: 0.8em; line-height: 1.2;">

- explicitly telling participants to "imagine" makes it even weaker than other fictional stimuli

- part 2: Overthrowing everything because of a new result is a rare event

</div>

:::

:::

<div style="font-size: 0.6em; line-height: 1.2;">

- not clear if this is ready to implement - other LLMs have done pre-test and seem to be ready to deploy
- could heavily backfire if the skeptical LLM turns out to be very convincing
- the least trusting participants will probably have a hard time coming up with pro-trust arguments
- other, more "classic" LLM interventions seem more safe to test here

</div>

:::

- In general: only overall rating + if will be tested or not

- In addition, to those in the top 20 and which are excluded, explanation regarding why
